intro: Dysoxylum laxiflorum, commonly known as the broad-leaved dysoxylum, is a tropical tree belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Dysoxylum laxiflorum is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in lowland rainforests.
